post.description: Send a reset password email. Requires email and current password for verification.

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

get.description: Initiates the Google OAuth2 login flow. Redirects to Google consent page. Use in browser.

get.description: OAuth2 callback. Exchanges code for tokens and creates/updates user. Returns auth tokens.

post.description: Authenticate with email and password. Returns access and refresh tokens on success.

parameters.description: Request body (email, password with strong-password validation)
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

post.description: Exchange a valid refresh token for a new access token.

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

post.description: Create a new user account. Returns user data and auth tokens on success.

parameters.description: Request body (name, email, password with strong-password validation)
parameters.name: request

parameters.name: request

Verify email address using the token from the verification email.

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

get.description: Check the status of services (PostgreSQL, Memory). Returns 200 when all healthy, 500 when any service is down.
Retrieve paginated list of users. Only admins (getUsers permission) can access. Supports search by name, email, or role.

parameters.description: Search by name, email, or role
parameters.name: search

post.description: Create a new user. Only admins (manageUsers permission) can create users.

parameters.description: Request body (name, email, password, role: user|admin)
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid request body or validation failed

get.description: Fetch user by ID. Users can fetch only their own data; admins (getUsers) can fetch any user.

delete.description: Delete user by ID. Users can delete only themselves; admins (manageUsers) can delete any user. All tokens are revoked.

patch.description: Update user by ID. Users can update only their own data; admins (manageUsers) can update any user. Provide at least one of name, email, or password.

parameters.description: Request body (name, email, password - all optional)
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid user ID or request body
